citation.article-title: Thermanaeromonas toyohensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel thermophilic anaerobe isolated from a subterranean vein in the Toyoha Mines.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Thermanaeromonas (Ther.man.aer.mo'nas. Gr. n. thermos hot; Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air ; Gr. n. monas unit, monad; N.L. fem. Thermanaeromonas thermophilic, anaerobic monad)
Gram reaction is negative, but cells possess a Gram-positive cell-wall structure.
Nonmotile and terminal endospores are formed.
Temperature range for growth is 55-73 Â°C.
Optimum growth conditions are neutral pH.
Thiosulfate is used as an electron acceptor for growth.
Nitrate and nitrite are also reduced.
MK-7 is the major quinone and MK- 8 also occurs as a minor quinone.
Major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15:0 and iso-C17:0.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type species is 49.6 mol% (as determined by HPLC).
Phylogenetic position based on 16S rDNA is in the Gram-positive bacteria.
The type species is Thermanaeromonas toyohensis.
